title: Stephen Fitzgerald (rugby union)
text:
Stephen Fitzgerald (born 13 November 1995) is an <a href="Irish%20people">Irish</a> former <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> player, who played for his native province <a href="Munster%20Rugby">Munster</a> and <a href="Connacht%20Rugby">Connacht</a> during his career. Fitzgerald played primarily as a <a href="Rugby%20union%20positions%23Full-back">fullback</a>, but could also play on either <a href="Rugby%20union%20positions%23Wing">wing</a>, and represented <a href="Shannon%20RFC">Shannon</a> in the <a href="All-Ireland%20League%20%28rugby%20union%29">All-Ireland League</a>.
Early life.
Born in <a href="Ardnacrusha">Ardnacrusha</a>, <a href="County%20Clare">County Clare</a>, Fitzgerald first began playing rugby aged 7 with <a href="Shannon%20RFC">Shannon</a>. He attended <a href="Ardscoil%20R%C3%ADs%2C%20Limerick">Ardscoil Rís, Limerick</a> and lost finals at both <a href="Munster%20Junior%20Cup">Junior</a> and <a href="Munster%20Schools%20Rugby%20Senior%20Cup">Senior</a> Cup level with the school. He represented Munster in all under-age grades, as well as playing Under-19s and Under-20s with Ireland.
Professional career.
Munster.
Fitzgerald made his debut for Munster on 13 September 2015, starting in the second game of the <a href="2015%E2%80%9316%20Pro12">2015–16 Pro12</a> against <a href="Ospreys%20%28rugby%20union%29">Ospreys</a> and scoring a try. On 1 June 2017, it was announced that Fitzgerald had been promoted to the senior Munster squad ahead of the 2017–18 season. He signed a one-year development contract extension with Munster in February 2018.
Bond University.
Having been injured for much of the 2016–17 season, Fitzgerald and then-fellow Munster Academy teammate JP Phelan played for Australian side <a href="Bond%20University%20Rugby%20Club">Bond University Rugby Club</a> in the <a href="Queensland%20Premier%20Rugby">Queensland Premier Rugby</a> competition. He made one appearance for the side, in round 10 against <a href="Sunnybank%20Rugby">Sunnybank</a>, but injured his hand and returned home soon after.
Connacht.
Fitzgerald joined Irish province <a href="Connacht%20Rugby">Connacht</a>, where his younger brother <a href="Conor%20Fitzgerald%20%28rugby%20union%29">Conor</a> was an academy player at the time, on a three-month loan deal in December 2018. He made his debut for Connacht in their 21–12 win against <a href="Ulster%20Rugby">Ulster</a> in round 12 of the <a href="2018%E2%80%9319%20Pro14">2018–19 Pro14</a> on 28 December 2018, replacing <a href="Kyle%20Godwin">Kyle Godwin</a> in the 63rd minute. Fitzgerald's loan was extended until the end of the 2018–19 season in March 2019.
Fitzgerald joined Connacht permanently for the 2019–20 season. 
Retirement.
A knee injury sustained in Connacht's fixture against <a href="Leinster%20Rugby">Leinster</a> in January 2020, for which Fitzgerald underwent three surgeries, forced Fitzgerald to retire from playing rugby at the end of the 2020–21 season.
Ireland.
Fitzgerald made his debut for Ireland Under-20s on 13 February 2015, starting against <a href="France%20national%20under-20%20rugby%20union%20team">France Under-20s</a> in the 2015 U20 Six Nations and scoring a try. He also represented Ireland Under-20s at the <a href="2015%20World%20Rugby%20Under%2020%20Championship">2015 World Rugby Under 20 Championship</a>, scoring two tries against <a href="Scotland%20national%20under-20%20rugby%20union%20team">Scotland Under-20s</a> on 20 June 2015.
